title: Proposal Stacked Graphical Learning Zhenzhen Kou Machine Learning
abstract: Traditional machine learning methods assume that instances are independent while in reality there are many relational datasets, such as hyperlinked web pages, scientific literature with dependencies among citations, social networks, and more. Recent work on graphical models has demonstrated performance improvement on relational data. In my thesis I plan to study a meta-learning scheme called stacked graphical learning. Given a relation template, the stacked graphical model augments a base learner by expanding one instance’s features with predictions on other related instances. The thesis proposal describes the algorithm for stacked graphical models, evaluates the approach on some real data and compares the performance to other methods. For my thesis I plan to explore more on the strength and weakness of the approach, and apply it to tasks in the SLIF system.
